DOC.brief_summary: This study aimed to examine the possible relationship between hand grip strength (HGS) and maximum inspiratory pressure (MIP) in healthy individuals.
DOC.brief_title: Correlation Between Maximal Inspiratory Pressure and Hand Grip Force
DOC.detailed_description: This study aimed to examine the possible relationship between hand grip strength (HGS) and maximum inspiratory pressure (MIP) in healthy individuals. All individuals underwent assessment of inspiratory muscle strength by maximum inspiratory pressure, and evaluation of hand grip strength. MIP was measured using a U-type water manometer calibrated in centimetre of water (cmH2O), while the HGS was measured with hydraulic hand dynamometer calibrated in Kg.
DOC.criteria: Healthy individuals age <20 years old, pregnancy, official diagnosis with lung disease such as Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), body mass index (BMI) > 40, known preexisting causes of neuromuscular weakness, median entrapment neuropathy such as carpal tunnel syndrome
